skill.name: ReasoningBank Intelligence
skill.description: Implement adaptive learning with ReasoningBank for pattern recognition, strategy optimization, and continuous improvement. Use when building self-learning agents, optimizing workflows, or implementing meta-cognitive systems.
skill.summary: Implement adaptive learning with ReasoningBank for pattern recognition, strategy optimization, and c...
skill.author: DNYoussef

security_audit.summary: This skill provides documentation for implementing ReasoningBank adaptive learning systems. It contains only TypeScript code examples and configuration patterns with no executable code, network calls, or file system access. The skill is purely educational and describes legitimate AI learning patterns.

content.user_title: Build Self-Learning AI Agents with Adaptive Intelligence
content.value_statement: AI agents waste time repeating the same mistakes and using suboptimal strategies. ReasoningBank Intelligence enables your agents to learn from every experience, recognize patterns, and continuously improve their performance over time.
actual_capabilities: Records and learns from task experiences with outcomes and metrics
Recognizes patterns in agent behavior and environmental triggers
Recommends optimal strategies based on historical performance
Implements transfer learning between related domains
Provides continuous learning with automatic model updates
limitations: Requires 100+ experiences per task type for reliable recommendations
Needs AgentDB for persistent storage and vector search capabilities
Performance depends on quality and consistency of recorded data
Learning rate and thresholds must be carefully tuned

use_cases.title: Create Self-Improving Code Review Agents
use_cases.description: Build agents that learn which review strategies find the most bugs and adapt their approach based on code complexity and language.

use_cases.title: Optimize CI/CD Pipeline Strategies
use_cases.description: Learn from deployment outcomes to predict failures and automatically select the safest deployment strategy for each situation.

use_cases.title: Implement Meta-Learning for Model Selection
use_cases.description: Create systems that learn which machine learning models work best for different types of data and automatically select optimal approaches.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Experience Recording
prompt_templates.prompt: Use ReasoningBank to record this experience: Task: API testing, Approach: automated_tests_first, Outcome: found 3 bugs in 15 minutes, Context: Node.js REST API

prompt_templates.title: Pattern Learning
prompt_templates.scenario: Teach the system a new pattern
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me implement pattern learning in ReasoningBank for this observation: When database queries slow down after 5pm, adding read replicas solves performance issues with 90% confidence

prompt_templates.title: Strategy Comparison
prompt_templates.prompt: Use ReasoningBank to compare these bug fixing strategies: debug_first, test_first, reproduce_then_fix. Show success rates and time metrics.

prompt_templates.title: Transfer Knowledge
prompt_templates.prompt: Implement knowledge transfer in ReasoningBank from JavaScript code review patterns to TypeScript code review, considering 80% similarity between languages

output_examples.input: Get optimal strategy for code review of a complex TypeScript project
output: Expected Outcome: Find 4-6 bugs in 20-30 minutes
Key Actions: Run ESLint first, then focus on type definitions, review complex generics last

best_practices: Record both successful and failed experiences to build balanced learning data
Include rich context like environment conditions, constraints, and relevant metadata
Set confidence thresholds to filter out low-quality learnings and prevent noise
anti_patterns: Only recording successes creates biased models that ignore failure patterns
Using generic context reduces pattern matching accuracy and recommendation quality
Keeping all historical data forever leads to storage bloat and slower queries

faq.question: Is this compatible with my existing Claude Code setup?
faq.answer: Yes, ReasoningBank Intelligence works with any Claude Code installation that has agentic-flow v1.5.11+ and AgentDB v1.0.4+.

faq.question: How much data do I need before seeing good recommendations?
faq.answer: You need at least 100 experiences per task type for reliable recommendations, with quality improving significantly after 500+ experiences.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with other AI tools besides Claude?
faq.answer: Yes, ReasoningBank works with Codex and other AI tools through the agentic-flow framework, storing learnings in a tool-agnostic format.

faq.question: Is my learning data safe and private?
faq.answer: All data is stored locally in your AgentDB instance. No learning data is sent to external services or shared with third parties.

faq.question: What if the system learns wrong patterns?
faq.answer: You can review and delete learned patterns, adjust confidence thresholds, or reset specific learning categories while keeping others.

faq.question: How does this compare to traditional ML model training?
faq.answer: ReasoningBank provides immediate incremental learning without lengthy training cycles, making it ideal for rapidly changing development environments.
